summary: App/project involves a game list; user wants to extend it with more classic games.
imageRequirements:

- Retro pixel-art Centipede scene preview (centipede-preview.dim_300x200.png)
- Retro pixel-art Missile Command defense scene preview (missile-command-preview.dim_300x200.png)

existing_features.title: Add six additional classic games to the arcade, each with a dedicated playable React/TypeScript game page that matches the existing UI/UX patterns used by current games (header back button, score panel, how-to-play panel, pause/reset controls where applicable, and an end-of-game score submission dialog that submits scores to the backend). The six games to add are: Centipede, Missile Command, Pinball, Bubble Shooter, Q*bert, and Dig Dug.

Update frontend routing and navigation so the six new games are reachable from the app: add routes in frontend/src/App.tsx, add Home page card navigation mappings (route + preview image mappings) in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx, and update Leaderboard navigation mapping in frontend/src/pages/LeaderboardPage.tsx so the "Play {game.name}" button works for all available games including the six newly-added games.

Add static preview images for the six new games under frontend/public/assets/generated using the existing preview image convention, and render them on the Home page game cards via the existing gameImages mapping.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add 6 more games to the app, specifically classic games

Extend the Motoko backend (single actor in backend/main.mo) to recognize the six new games (Centipede, Missile Command, Pinball, Bubble Shooter, Q*bert, Dig Dug) in getAvailableGames(), and to store/retrieve high scores for each via getHighScores(), getPlayerScore(), and submitScore() without trapping or returning an empty non-persistent map for these game names.

If adding the six new backend score maps changes stable state shape compared to deployed versions, add/adjust backend/migration.mo so existing deployments can upgrade without trapping and existing stored scores for current games remain intact.

projectName: Add 6 additional classic games to Retro Arcade
